title: Calculate Rectangle Area
description: Write a program that declares variables for length and width, assigns values (length = 10, width = 5), calculates the area, and outputs the result.
hints: Declare three INTEGER variables: Length, Width, and Area
Use the <- operator to assign values
solution:
DECLARE Length : INTEGER
DECLARE Width : INTEGER
DECLARE Area : INTEGER

Length <- 10
Width <- 5
Area <- Length * Width

OUTPUT "The area is: ", Area

title: Pass or Fail
description: Write a program that inputs a student's score (0-100) and outputs "Pass" if the score is 50 or above, or "Fail" otherwise.
hints: Use INPUT to get the score
solution:
DECLARE Score : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter your score:"
INPUT Score

IF Score >= 50 THEN
    OUTPUT "Pass"
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Fail"

title: Temperature Converter
description: Write a program that converts Celsius to Fahrenheit. Formula: F = (C * 9/5) + 32. Input temperature in Celsius and output in Fahrenheit.
hints: Use REAL data type for decimal values
solution:
DECLARE Celsius : REAL
DECLARE Fahrenheit : REAL

OUTPUT "Enter temperature in Celsius: "
INPUT Celsius

Fahrenheit <- (Celsius * 9 / 5) + 32

OUTPUT "Temperature in Fahrenheit: ", Fahrenheit

title: Grade Calculator
description: Input a mark (0-100) and output the grade: A (90+), B (80-89), C (70-79), D (60-69), F (below 60).
hints: Check from highest grade to lowest
Remember to use ELSE for F grade
solution:
DECLARE Mark : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter mark: "
INPUT Mark

IF Mark >= 90 THEN
    OUTPUT "Grade: A"
ELSE IF Mark >= 80 THEN
    OUTPUT "Grade: B"
ELSE IF Mark >= 70 THEN
    OUTPUT "Grade: C"
ELSE IF Mark >= 60 THEN
    OUTPUT "Grade: D"
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Grade: F"
ENDIF

hints: Use FOR loop with counter from 1 TO 10
solution:
DECLARE Counter : INTEGER

FOR Counter <- 1 TO 10
    OUTPUT Counter
NEXT Counter

title: Sum of Numbers
description: Calculate the sum of numbers from 1 to 100 using a FOR loop.
solution:
DECLARE Sum, Counter : INTEGER

Sum <- 0

FOR Counter <- 1 TO 100
    Sum <- Sum + Counter
NEXT Counter

OUTPUT "Sum of 1 to 100: ", Sum

title: WHILE Loop - Password
description: Create a password checker using WHILE loop. Keep asking until user enters "secret". Maximum 3 attempts.
hints: Use WHILE loop with attempt counter
solution:
DECLARE Password : STRING
DECLARE Attempts : INTEGER

Attempts <- 0
Password <- ""

WHILE Password <> "secret" AND Attempts < 3 DO
    OUTPUT "Enter password: "
    INPUT Password
    Attempts <- Attempts + 1
    IF Password <> "secret" THEN
        OUTPUT "Incorrect! Try again."
    ENDIF
ENDWHILE

IF Password = "secret" THEN
    OUTPUT "Access granted!"
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Access denied. Too many attempts."
ENDIF

title: Array Input and Output
description: Create an array of 5 numbers, input values from user, and output all values.

Use FOR loop to input values
Use another FOR loop to output
solution:

NEXT i

OUTPUT "Your numbers:"

title: Find Maximum in Array
description: Input 5 numbers into an array, then find and output the maximum value.
hints: Loop through array comparing each element
Update maximum when larger value found
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:5] OF INTEGER
DECLARE i, Max : INTEGER

FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

Max <- Numbers[1]
FOR i <- 2 TO 5
    IF Numbers[i] > Max THEN

title: Calculate Average
description: Input 10 numbers into an array, calculate and output the average.
hints: Divide sum by number of elements
Use REAL for average to handle decimals
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:10] OF INTEGER

Sum <- 0

FOR i <- 1 TO 10
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]

NEXT i

title: Square Function

solution:

title: Check Even or Odd
description: Create a function that returns TRUE if a number is even, FALSE if odd.
solution:
FUNCTION IsEven(N : INTEGER) RETURNS BOOLEAN
    IF N MOD 2 = 0 THEN
        RETURN TRUE
    ELSE
        RETURN FALSE
    ENDIF
ENDFUNCTION

DECLARE Number : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter a number: "
INPUT Number

IF IsEven(Number) THEN
    OUTPUT "Even"
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Odd"
ENDIF

title: Linear Search
description: Search for a specific number in an array of 10 numbers. Output position if found, or "Not found".
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:10] OF INTEGER
DECLARE Search, i, Position : INTEGER
DECLARE Found : BOOLEAN

FOR i <- 1 TO 10
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Enter number to search: "
INPUT Search

Found <- FALSE
FOR i <- 1 TO 10
    IF Numbers[i] = Search THEN
        Found <- TRUE
        Position <- i
    ENDIF
NEXT i

IF Found THEN
    OUTPUT "Found at position ", Position
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Not found"
ENDIF

title: Bubble Sort
description: Sort an array of 5 numbers in ascending order using bubble sort algorithm.
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:5] OF INTEGER
DECLARE i, j, Temp : INTEGER

FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

FOR i <- 1 TO 4
    FOR j <- 1 TO 5 - i
        IF Numbers[j] > Numbers[j + 1] THEN
            Temp <- Numbers[j]
            Numbers[j] <- Numbers[j + 1]
            Numbers[j + 1] <- Temp
        ENDIF
    NEXT j
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Sorted array:"
FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    OUTPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

title: Count Vowels
description: Input a string and count the number of vowels (A, E, I, O, U - case insensitive).
hints: Check if character is A, E, I, O, or U
solution:
DECLARE Text, Upper, Char : STRING
DECLARE i, Count : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter text: "
INPUT Text

Upper <- UCASE(Text)
Count <- 0

FOR i <- 1 TO LENGTH(Upper)
    Char <- SUBSTRING(Upper, i, 1)
    IF Char = "A" OR Char = "E" OR Char = "I" OR Char = "O" OR Char = "U" THEN
        Count <- Count + 1
    ENDIF
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Number of vowels: ", Count

title: Running Total

title: Swap Two Numbers
description: Create a procedure using BYREF to swap two numbers.
hints: Values should be swapped in main program
solution:
PROCEDURE Swap(BYREF A : INTEGER, BYREF B : INTEGER)
    DECLARE Temp : INTEGER
    Temp <- A
    A <- B
    B <- Temp
ENDPROCEDURE

DECLARE X, Y : INTEGER

X <- 10
Y <- 20

OUTPUT "Before: X=", X, " Y=", Y

CALL Swap(X, Y)

OUTPUT "After: X=", X, " Y=", Y

title: Factorial Function
description: Create a function to calculate factorial of a number (e.g., 5! = 120).
hints: Use FOR loop from 1 to N
solution:
FUNCTION Factorial(N : INTEGER) RETURNS INTEGER
    DECLARE Result, i : INTEGER
    Result <- 1
    FOR i <- 1 TO N
        Result <- Result * i
    NEXT i
    RETURN Result
ENDFUNCTION

DECLARE Number, Answer : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter number: "
INPUT Number

Answer <- Factorial(Number)

OUTPUT "Factorial: ", Answer

title: Statistics Calculator
description: Input 10 numbers and calculate: total, average, count of evens, count of odds.
solution:

Evens <- 0

    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "

title: Leap Year Checker
description: Input a year and determine if it's a leap year. Rules: divisible by 4, except centuries unless divisible by 400.
hints: Then check if divisible by 100 (not leap)
solution:
DECLARE Year : INTEGER
DECLARE IsLeap : BOOLEAN

OUTPUT "Enter year: "
INPUT Year

IF Year MOD 400 = 0 THEN
    IsLeap <- TRUE
ELSE IF Year MOD 100 = 0 THEN
    IsLeap <- FALSE
ELSE IF Year MOD 4 = 0 THEN
    IsLeap <- TRUE
ELSE
    IsLeap <- FALSE
ENDIF

IF IsLeap THEN
    OUTPUT Year, " is a leap year"
ELSE
    OUTPUT Year, " is not a leap year"
ENDIF

title: Number Guessing Game

    ELSE IF Guess > Target THEN

    ENDIF

title: Palindrome Checker
description: Check if a string is a palindrome (reads same forwards and backwards).
hints: Use SUBSTRING to get individual characters
solution:
DECLARE Text : STRING
DECLARE i, Len : INTEGER
DECLARE IsPalindrome : BOOLEAN

OUTPUT "Enter text: "
INPUT Text

Len <- LENGTH(Text)
IsPalindrome <- TRUE

FOR i <- 1 TO Len DIV 2
    IF SUBSTRING(Text, i, 1) <> SUBSTRING(Text, Len - i + 1, 1) THEN
        IsPalindrome <- FALSE
    ENDIF
NEXT i

IF IsPalindrome THEN
    OUTPUT "Is a palindrome"
ELSE
    OUTPUT "Not a palindrome"
ENDIF

title: Is Prime Function
description: Create a function to check if a number is prime (only divisible by 1 and itself).
hints: Return FALSE if any divisor found
solution:
FUNCTION IsPrime(N : INTEGER) RETURNS BOOLEAN
    DECLARE i : INTEGER
    IF N < 2 THEN
        RETURN FALSE
    ENDIF
    FOR i <- 2 TO N - 1
        IF N MOD i = 0 THEN
            RETURN FALSE
        ENDIF
    NEXT i
    RETURN TRUE
ENDFUNCTION

DECLARE Number : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter number: "
INPUT Number

IF IsPrime(Number) THEN
    OUTPUT Number, " is prime"
ELSE
    OUTPUT Number, " is not prime"
ENDIF

title: Selection Sort
description: Sort 6 numbers using selection sort algorithm.
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:6] OF INTEGER
DECLARE i, j, MinIndex, Temp : INTEGER

FOR i <- 1 TO 6
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    MinIndex <- i
    FOR j <- i + 1 TO 6
        IF Numbers[j] < Numbers[MinIndex] THEN
            MinIndex <- j
        ENDIF
    NEXT j
    IF MinIndex <> i THEN
        Temp <- Numbers[i]
        Numbers[i] <- Numbers[MinIndex]
        Numbers[MinIndex] <- Temp
    ENDIF
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Sorted:"
FOR i <- 1 TO 6
    OUTPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

title: Running Balance
description: Start with $1000. Input transactions (positive=deposit, negative=withdrawal) until 0. Show balance after each.
solution:
DECLARE Balance, Transaction : REAL

Balance <- 1000.0

OUTPUT "Starting balance: $", Balance

    INPUT Transaction
    IF Transaction <> 0 THEN
        Balance <- Balance + Transaction
        OUTPUT "Balance: $", Balance
    ENDIF
UNTIL Transaction = 0

OUTPUT "Final balance: $", Balance

title: Count Words
description: Input a sentence and count the number of words (words are separated by spaces).
hints: Or use LENGTH to iterate and count spaces
solution:
DECLARE Text, Char : STRING
DECLARE i, Words : INTEGER
DECLARE InWord : BOOLEAN

OUTPUT "Enter sentence: "
INPUT Text

Words <- 0
InWord <- FALSE

FOR i <- 1 TO LENGTH(Text)
    Char <- SUBSTRING(Text, i, 1)
    IF Char <> " " THEN
        IF InWord = FALSE THEN
            Words <- Words + 1
            InWord <- TRUE
        ENDIF
    ELSE
        InWord <- FALSE
    ENDIF
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Number of words: ", Words

title: Maximum of Three
description: Create a function that returns the maximum of three numbers.
solution:
FUNCTION Max3(A : INTEGER, B : INTEGER, C : INTEGER) RETURNS INTEGER
    DECLARE Max : INTEGER
    IF A > B THEN
        Max <- A
    ELSE
        Max <- B
    ENDIF
    IF C > Max THEN
        Max <- C
    ENDIF
    RETURN Max
ENDFUNCTION

DECLARE X, Y, Z, Result : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter three numbers:"
INPUT X
INPUT Y
INPUT Z

Result <- Max3(X, Y, Z)

OUTPUT "Maximum: ", Result

title: Find Duplicates
description: Input 10 numbers. Report if there are any duplicate values.
hints: Use nested loops to compare each pair
Can stop search after finding first duplicate
solution:
DECLARE Numbers : ARRAY[1:10] OF INTEGER
DECLARE i, j : INTEGER
DECLARE Found : BOOLEAN

FOR i <- 1 TO 10
    OUTPUT "Enter number ", i, ": "
    INPUT Numbers[i]
NEXT i

Found <- FALSE

FOR i <- 1 TO 9
    FOR j <- i + 1 TO 10
        IF Numbers[i] = Numbers[j] THEN
            Found <- TRUE
            OUTPUT "Duplicate found: ", Numbers[i]
        ENDIF
    NEXT j
NEXT i

IF Found = FALSE THEN
    OUTPUT "No duplicates"
ENDIF

title: Draw Rectangle
description: Create a procedure that draws a rectangle using asterisks. Parameters: width and height.
solution:
PROCEDURE DrawRectangle(Width : INTEGER, Height : INTEGER)
    DECLARE Row, Col : INTEGER
    FOR Row <- 1 TO Height
        FOR Col <- 1 TO Width
            OUTPUT "*"
        NEXT Col
        OUTPUT ""
    NEXT Row
ENDPROCEDURE

DECLARE W, H : INTEGER

OUTPUT "Enter width: "
INPUT W
OUTPUT "Enter height: "
INPUT H

CALL DrawRectangle(W, H)

title: Student Grade System
description: Input 5 students' names and scores. Calculate average, find highest, display all with pass/fail (50% pass mark).
hints: Use parallel arrays for names and scores
solution:
DECLARE Names : ARRAY[1:5] OF STRING
DECLARE Scores : ARRAY[1:5] OF INTEGER
DECLARE i, Total, Highest, HighestIndex : INTEGER
DECLARE Average : REAL

Total <- 0
Highest <- 0

FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    OUTPUT "Student ", i, " name: "
    INPUT Names[i]
    OUTPUT "Score: "
    INPUT Scores[i]
    Total <- Total + Scores[i]
    IF Scores[i] > Highest THEN
        Highest <- Scores[i]
        HighestIndex <- i
    ENDIF
NEXT i

Average <- REAL(Total) / 5.0

OUTPUT "Results:"
FOR i <- 1 TO 5
    OUTPUT Names[i], ": ", Scores[i]
    IF Scores[i] >= 50 THEN
        OUTPUT "PASS"
    ELSE
        OUTPUT "FAIL"
    ENDIF
NEXT i

OUTPUT "Average: ", Average
OUTPUT "Highest: ", Names[HighestIndex], " (", Highest, ")"
